item.title: Notable Emacs Features
item.description:
An introduction

Hey all,

This is an attempt to make a post about my emacs setup and why I (a vim guy) now use emacs. Has that been done before, by someone much better with emacs than I am in a talk format? Yes, but ignore that for a second. As someone who really does think emacs-style chording isn’t pleasant (and prefers modal editing à la vim) I still think there’s potential in the “editor” we call emacs.

First, why emacs?

So, my real reasons for switching to emacs were twofold. Let’s look into them:

Org-mode

This was the first, and biggest, reason I made the jump to emacs. Org-mode is an outline system, a todo-management program, a LaTeX-exporter, a scheduling and agenda-making utility, a spreadsheet editor, a blog-posting and wiki-editing utility, and likely a half dozen other things I can’t remember off the top of my head.
